movies.title: Boulevard des plaisirs
movies.originalTitle: Auf der Reeperbahn nachts um halb eins

biography.bio: Life companion was the actress Hansi Burg. Their relationship started in 1925. They separated in 1935 due to the pressure of the German Nazi government. In 1938 she went into exile in Switzerland (later London). Shortly after this she married the Norwegian Erich Blydt. Burg returned to Germany and Albers in 1946. They lived together until his death 1960. She died 15 years later.
biography.name: Hans Albers

biography.bio: Heinz Rühmann was born on March 7, 1902 in Essen, Germany as Heinrich Wilhelm Rühmann. He was an actor and producer, known for It Happened in Broad Daylight (1958), Ce diable de garçon (1944) and The Captain from Köpenick (1956). He was married to Hertha Droemer, Hertha Feiler and Maria Herbot. He died on October 3, 1994 in Aufkirchen, Bavaria, Germany.
biography.name: Heinz Rühmann

biography.bio: A vivacious and very attractive blonde supporting actress and occasional singer, Frieda Elfriede Benkhoff was the equivalent of a German Eve Arden. Even though she rarely commanded a leading role, she was an effervescent, perpetually wisecracking scene stealer, who invariably had the last word, whether as friend of the heroine, gossipy aunt or nosy parker. Fita began her working life as a dental assistant and telephone operator, while training for acting in her own time. She made her first theatrical appearance in "Don Carlos" at Dortmund's Stadttheater in 1925. This was soon followed by comic turns on the larger stages of Berlin and Vienna, after which she was signed by Germany's premier film studio Ufa for a series of short featurettes. Fita was already 34, when she made her breakthrough as a feisty maid in Reinhold Schünzel's off-beat comedy Amphitryon (1935). She established such a popular rapport with the actor Paul Kemp, that she was cast opposite him in further popular outings, including Boccaccio (1936), and, for once co-starring, in The Bashful Casanova (1936). After successive critical plaudits with Love in Stunt Flying (1937), Nuits de Vienne (1939) and Das Fräulein von Barnhelm (1940), Fita had become firmly established as one of Germany's leading comediennes. She continued her career with some success after the war, gradually drifting into character roles, notably as Mother Wolff in Gerhart Hauptmann's The Beaver Coat (1949). After the death of her husband in 1957, she went into quasi-retirement. In the year of her death, 1967, her contribution was deservedly recognised with a Bambi Award.
biography.name: Fita Benkhoff

biography.bio: Erwin Strahl was born on February 12, 1929 in Vienna, Austria. He was an actor and director, known for Les honneurs de la guerre (1961), Face of the Frog (1959) and Sacred Lie (1954). He was married to Waltraut Haas and Franca Parisi. He died on April 20, 2011 in Vienna.
biography.name: Erwin Strahl

biography.bio: Sybil Werden was born on September 3, 1924 in Berlin, Germany. She was an actress, known for Mon ami le clown (1955), Desires (1952) and Docteurs et infirmières (1955). She was married to Harald Juhnke. She died on July 27, 2007 in Munich, Bavaria, Germany.
biography.name: Sybil Werden

biography.bio: Gustav Knuth was born on 7 July 1901 in Brunswick, Germany. After he received acting lessons from Casimir Paris, a well known actor at that time, he made his stage debut at the Stadttheater Heidelberg in 1918. Later, he played in Hamburg and also in Basel, Switzerland, but finally returned to Hamburg. In 1935, his first movie Der Ammenkönig (1935) became a unexpected success and many more such as the legendary Port of Freedom (1944) or the Sissi (1955) trilogy in the 1950s followed. After World War II, his stage career continued in Switzerland, where he lived in Küsnacht and was ensemble member at the Schauspielhaus Zurich. On 1 February 1987, he died of a stroke in Neu-Münster near Zurich, Switzerland.
biography.name: Gustav Knuth

biography.bio: Fritz Wagner was born on March 19, 1915 in Heilbronn, Baden-Württemberg, Germany. He was an actor, known for The Bridge (1949), Film Without a Name (1948) and Freies Land (1946). He died on January 19, 1982 in Bonn, North Rhine-Westphalia, West Germany.
biography.name: Fritz Wagner

biography.bio: Helga Franck was born in 1933 in Lübeck, Schleswig-Holstein, Germany. She was an actress, known for Body in the Web (1960), Heiraten verboten (1957) and Boulevard des plaisirs (1954). She was married to Lothar E. Stickelbrucks. She died in February 1963 in Munich, West Germany [now Germany].
biography.name: Helga Franck

biography.bio: Jürgen Graf is an actor, known for Boulevard des plaisirs (1954), Les frénétiques (1957) and Seamen (1957).
biography.name: Jürgen Graf

biography.placeOfBirth: Breslau, Silesia, Germany [now Wroclaw, Dolnoslaskie, Poland]
biography.bio: Wolfgang Neuss was born on December 3, 1923 in Breslau, Silesia, Germany as Hans Otto Wolfgang Neuss. He was an actor and writer, known for We Cellar Children (1960), The Captain from Köpenick (1956) and 20 Minuten Aufenthalt (1960). He was married to Margareta Henriksson. He died on May 5, 1989 in West Berlin, West Germany.
biography.name: Wolfgang Neuss

biography.bio: Else Reval was born on June 14, 1893 in Berlin, Germany. She was an actress, known for Zwischenfall im Roxy (1954), Das Fenster im 2. Stock (1939) and Barbara, wo bist Du? (1939). She died on January 25, 1978 in West Berlin, West Germany.
biography.name: Else Reval

biography.bio: Liselotte Malkowsky was a German-Danish singer in the class of 'Zarah Leander', Lale Andersen and Édith Piaf. She was in the German-Austrian underground against the Nazis in WWII. Right after the war, she worked for the USO in West-Germany as a singer and recorded many records for Polydor. Some of her songs in German are: "Aloha Oe", "Chanson des adieux", "La Seine", "Auf der Reperbahn Nachts um Halb eins", "La Paloma" and so many more.
biography.name: Liselotte Malkowsky

biography.bio: Carl Hinrichs was born on September 18, 1907 in Oldenburg, Germany. He was an actor, known for Das fröhliche Dorf (1955), Stine vom Löh auf großer Fahrt (1961) and Was die Schwalbe sang (1956). He died on December 7, 1967 in Oldenburg.
biography.name: Carl Hinrichs

biography.bio: Wulf Rittscher was born on August 16, 1902 in Lübeck, Schleswig-Holstein, Germany as Wulff Hemberger-Rittscher. He was an actor, known for Max und Moritz (1956), Tischlein, deck dich (1956) and Charley's Aunt (1956). He died on March 10, 1957 in Berlin, Germany.
biography.name: Wulf Rittscher

biography.bio: Wolfgang Müller was born on December 14, 1922 in Berlin, Germany. He was an actor, known for The Captain from Köpenick (1956), Roses for the Prosecutor (1959) and Als geheilt entlassen (1960). He died on April 26, 1960 in Lostallo, Graubünden, Switzerland.
biography.name: Wolfgang Müller
